patterns: What is Rwanda Governance Board?
Tell me about Rwanda Governance Board
What does Rwanda Governance Board do?
responses: Rwanda Governance Board (RGB) is an independent public institution responsible for ensuring good governance practices in the public and private sector in Rwanda. Its aim is to promote integrity, transparency, accountability, and the rule of law.

patterns: What is the vision of Rwanda Governance Board?
Tell me about the vision of Rwanda Governance Board
responses: The vision of Rwanda Governance Board is to be a leading institution in promoting good governance practices in Rwanda.

patterns: What is the mission of Rwanda Governance Board?
Tell me about the mission of Rwanda Governance Board
responses: The mission of Rwanda Governance Board is to promote integrity, transparency, accountability and the rule of law in the public and private sector, in order to contribute to sustainable development in Rwanda.

patterns: What is the mandate of Rwanda Governance Board?
Tell me about the mandate of Rwanda Governance Board
responses: The mandate of Rwanda Governance Board is to ensure good governance practices in the public and private sector, and to promote integrity, transparency, accountability, and the rule of law.

patterns: Who are the members of RGB?
Can you tell me the names of the members of the Rwanda Governance Board?
What are the names of the people on RGB board?
responses: The members of Rwanda Governance Board (RGB) are: 1. Jean Pierre Karabaranga (Chairperson), 2. Francoise Mukankusi, 3. Jean Bosco Mutangana, 4. Godfrey Musoni, 5. Rose Rwabuhihi, 6. Anastase Shyaka and 7. Ezechias Nkurunziza.

patterns: What is the mission of RGB?
What is the purpose of Rwanda Governance Board?
Can you explain the mission of the Rwanda Governance Board?
responses: The mission of Rwanda Governance Board (RGB) is to enhance the quality of governance in Rwanda by promoting ethics, accountability, transparency, and integrity in the public and private sectors.

patterns: What are the values of RGB?
Can you tell me the values of Rwanda Governance Board?
What are the guiding principles of RGB?
responses: The values of Rwanda Governance Board (RGB) are: ethics, accountability, transparency, and integrity.

patterns: What is the vision of RGB?
Can you explain the vision of Rwanda Governance Board?
What is the future goal of RGB?
responses: The vision of Rwanda Governance Board (RGB) is to be a leader in promoting good governance practices and a reference in the fight against corruption in Rwanda and the region.

responses: The Rwanda Governance Board advises the government on the implementation of the decentralization and capacity development policy and on activities meant for building the capacity of decentralized entities.

promote democracy
performance and quality services delivery
advise government and other concerned institutions
responses: The Rwanda Governance Board promotes the principles of good governance, democracy, performance, and quality services delivery and advises the government and other concerned institutions thereof.

patterns: What are the guiding principles of RGB?
Can you tell me the guiding principles of RGB?
What are the guiding values of Rwanda Governance Board?
responses: The guiding principles of RGB are to promote good governance and quality service delivery in all operations, to promote citizen-centred governance, to be characterized by diligence and expertise, to promote unity and reconciliation among Rwandans, to promote a culture of home-grown innovations in performance and governance, to work through democracy, transparency, dialogue and consultation, to promote a culture of excellence and time management, and to be characterized by integrity and high standards in its functioning.

patterns: What are the rights of clients of RGB?
Can you list the rights of clients of RGB?
What are the client's rights at RGB?
responses: Our clients have the right to quality and timely services, access information in accordance with the law, timely feedback on requested services, respect and fair treatment, and demand service and file a complaint in case of poor service.

patterns: What are the obligations of clients of RGB?
Can you list the obligations of clients of RGB?
What are the responsibilities of clients towards RGB?
responses: Our clients have the following obligations: to fulfill terms and conditions for the service, provide full and transparent disclosure of service-related information, and be cooperative and understanding.

patterns: what services are offered by RGB?
What are the services offered by RGB?
responses: RGB offers registration of local and international non-governmental organizations, political parties, and faith-based organizations.

patterns: how do I register my NGO?
What is the procedure to register an NGO?
responses: The procedures for registering an NGO are available on the RGB website. You can access the services online anytime or visit the Department of CSO & Political Organizations from Monday to Thursday between 7:00 AM and 5:00 PM or on Fridays from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM. The maximum time for an NGO to get registered is 90 days.

patterns: who do I contact for NGO registration?
Where can I get help with registering an NGO?
responses: You can contact the Head of department of Political Organizations and Civil Society Organizations, Ms. Judith KAZAIRE at 0788305622 or by email at jkazaire@rgb.rw for help with registering an NGO.

patterns: what are the requirements for registering an NGO?
What documents are needed to register an NGO?
responses: The requirements for registering an NGO are available on the RGB website under the title 'Operational certificate for LNGO'. You can also find related forms on the Irembo Portal and RGB website for all registration-related services.

patterns: how do I register my FBO?
What is the procedure to register an FBO?
responses: The procedures for registering an FBO are available on the RGB website. You can access the services online anytime or visit the Department of CSO & Political Organizations from Monday to Thursday between 7:00 AM and 5:00 PM or on Fridays from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM. The maximum time for an FBO to get registered is 60 days.

patterns: who do I contact for FBO registration?
Where can I get help with registering an FBO?
responses: You can contact the Head of department of Political Organizations and Civil Society Organizations, Ms. Judith KAZAIRE at 0788305622 or by email at jkazaire@rgb.rw for help with registering an FBO.

patterns: how to register a local ngo
registering an international ngo
registering a political party
registering a faith-based organization
ngo registration process
fbo registration process
responses: To register a local NGO, you can approach the Department of CSO & Political Organizations by emailing ngoregistration@rgb.rw. For FBOs, you can email fbocompliance@rgb.rw for compliance files or fbolp@rgb.rw for registration. For INGOs, you can email ingo@rgb.rw. Online services are available 24/7, while on-site services are available from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm from Monday to Thursday and from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm on Friday. The maximum time for FBO registration is 60 days, while it is 90 days for NGOs. Consult the RGB website (www.rgb.rw) for information on requirements and procedures for accessing the services, as well as the cost of registration and relevant legal instruments.

how to pay for goods and services rendered to rgb
rgb payment options
how to make payment to rgb
responses: Payment for goods and services rendered to RGB can be made through various options such as mobile money, bank transfer, and cash. You can contact the RGB finance department at finance@rgb.rw for more information on the payment options.

patterns: complaint procedure for ngo registration
how to make a complaint about fbo registration
where to report a complaint about payment for goods and services
who to contact for complaints about rgb services
responses: For any complaints related to the registration of NGOs and FBOs, or payment for goods and services rendered to RGB, you can contact the Head of the Department of Political Organizations and Civil Society Organizations, Ms. Judith KAZAIRE, on 0788305622 or via email at jkazaire@rgb.rw.

patterns: I want to apply for pre-authorization for research project
I need to get pre-approval for my research project
How do I apply for pre-authorization for research project?
responses: You can apply for pre-authorization for a governance and home grown solutions research project by visiting the Department of Home Grown Solutions. They are available from Monday to Thursday from 7:00am to 5:00pm and on Fridays from 7:00am to 3:30pm.

To apply, you need to complete an application form, which can be found on the RGB website (www.rgb.rw), and submit it online along with a detailed research project proposal and CVs of the research team.
It typically takes at least 14 days from the date of receiving the complete application for the pre-authorization to be granted.
